study_plan_entry.title: Semiconductor electronic and optoelectronic devices II

free_text.Learning outcomes: To present the physical principles of operation and the main applications of semiconductor optoelectronic devices
free_text.Content: [b]1. Semiconductor materials for optoelectronics[/b][br/][b]2. Light-matter interactions in semiconductors[/b][br/]Absorption, spontaneous and stimulated emission of radiation, dielectric[br/]function, optical constants.[br/][b]3. Nanostructures and microcavities[/b][br/]Quantum wells, superlattices quantum dots, microcavities strong coupling[br/]regime, Purcell effect.[br/][b]4. Electroluminescence[/b][br/]Electroluminescent diodes, emission spectra, efficiency. Applications for[br/]displays and lighting.[br/][b]5. Laser diodes[/b][br/]Conditions to achieve stimulated emission, optical gain and threshold,[br/]spectral characteristics, efficiency. Fabry-Perot, distributed feedback and[br/]vertical cavity laser structures. Bandgap engineering, quantum well[br/]lasers. Quantum cascade lasers.[br/][br/]
